content.html: It seems that with the recent improvements to ActivityPub support one can use Micro.blog as a Fediverse instance, Micropub client and Feed reader. How cool is that?! It‚Äôs certainly the most convenient ‚ÄúIndieWeb timeline‚Äù on mobile.
content.value: It seems that with the recent improvements to ActivityPub support one can use Micro.blog as a Fediverse instance, Micropub client and Feed reader. How cool is that?! It‚Äôs certainly the most convenient ‚ÄúIndieWeb timeline‚Äù on mobile.

content.html:
If there‚Äôs no custom domain, what does the Mastodon-compatible username look like? @username@micro.blog of course! In this way, Micro.blog looks a lot more like another Mastodon instance, but an instance that also has a full suite of blogging features, IndieWeb protocols, and everything else we‚Äôve been building for years.

I abandoned my barely active account on birdsite recently and I was giving the Fosstodon instance a try, but I‚Äôve been cross-posting from my IndieWebsite to M.b for a while now. Micro.blog is offering (including free users like me) a great opportunity to bridge 3 communities together. This is game changer.
content.value: If there‚Äôs no custom domain, what does the Mastodon-compatible username look like? @username@micro.blog of course! In this way, Micro.blog looks a lot more like another Mastodon instance, but an instance that also has a full suite of blogging features, IndieWeb protocols, and everything else we‚Äôve been building for years.I abandoned my barely active account on birdsite recently and I was giving the Fosstodon instance a try, but I‚Äôve been cross-posting from my IndieWebsite to M.b for a while now. Micro.blog is offering (including free users like me) a great opportunity to bridge 3 communities together. This is game changer.

content.html:
Having lived in one of the warmest regions of Colombia all my life and now approaching my first autumn in Europe, wearing coats is something new for me, but as I get used to the extra pockets, I realize that now I can carry my whole CD collection with me by plugging a pair of good headphones and a DAC to my old and reliable iPhone SE.

Not that this kind of setup wasn‚Äôt possible before or that it‚Äôs really necessary (since any streaming service does the job just fine), it‚Äôs just that high quality audio on-the-go on an iPhone has always required an ugly dongle fest…

If autumn brings the pockets, I might as well use them ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

content.html: Hetzner understandably increasing their prices has led me to give up on my dedicated server and migrate to a cheaper VPS option. Among the services I had to move was Wiktoria‚Äôs blog. There were no issues really, other than the hassle of setting up a MySQL server exclusively for Wordpress. I wish it was as simple as it was to move my website: Copy, paste & GoBlog…
